t: Job 34
Elihu Vindicates God’s Justice
Then*p Elihu continued and said,
“Hear*pn my words, you wise men, And*ln listen to me, you who know.
For*ln the ear tests words As*ln the palate tastes food.
Let*ln us choose for ourselves what is right; Let*ln us know among ourselves what is good.
For*ln Job has said, ‘I am righteous, But*ln God has taken away my right;
Should*ln I lie concerning my right? My*ln wound is incurable, though*i I*i am*i without transgression.’
What*ln man is like Job, Who*ln drinks up derision like water,
Who*ln goes in company with the workers of iniquity, And*ln walks with wicked men?
For*ln he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing When*ln he is pleased with God.’
“Therefore,*ln listen to me, you men of understanding. Far*ln be it from God to do wickedness, And*ln from the Almighty to do wrong.
For*ln He pays a man according to his work, And*ln makes him find it according to his way.
Surely,*ln God will not act wickedly, And*ln the Almighty will not pervert justice.
Who*ln gave Him authority over the earth? And*ln who has laid on*i Him*i the whole world?
If*ln He should determine to do so, If*ln He should gather to Himself His spirit and His breath,
All*ln flesh would perish together, And*ln man would return to dust.
“But*ln if you*i have*i understanding, hear this; Listen*ln to the sound of my words.
Shall*ln one who hates justice rule? And*ln will you condemn the righteous mighty One,
Who*ln says to a king, ‘Worthless one,’ To*ln nobles, ‘Wicked ones’;
Who*ln shows no partiality to princes Nor*ln regards the rich above the poor, For*ln they all are the work of His hands?
In*ln a moment they die, and at midnight People*ln are shaken and pass away, And*ln the mighty are taken away without a hand.
“For*ln His eyes are upon the ways of a man, And*ln He sees all his steps.
There*ln is no darkness or deep shadow Where*ln the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
For*ln He does not need*i to*i consider a man further, That*ln he should go before God in judgment.
He*ln breaks in pieces mighty men without inquiry, And*ln sets others in their place.
Therefore*ln He knows their works, And*ln He overthrows them*i in the night, And*ln they are crushed.
He*ln strikes them like the wicked In*ln a public place,
Because*ln they turned aside from following Him, And*ln had no regard for any of His ways;
So*ln that they caused the cry of the poor to come to Him, And*ln that He might hear the cry of the afflicted—
When*ln He keeps quiet, who then can condemn? And*ln when He hides His face, who then can behold Him, That*ln is, in regard to both nation and man?—
So*ln that godless men would not rule Nor*ln be snares of the people.
“For*ln has anyone said to God, ‘I*ln have borne chastisement;*i I*ln will not offend anymore;*i
Teach*ln me what I do not see; If*ln I have done iniquity, I*ln will not do it again’?
Shall*ln He recompense on your terms, because you have rejected it?*i For*ln you must choose, and not I; Therefore*ln declare what you know.
Men*ln of understanding will say to me, And*ln a wise man who hears me,
‘Job*ln speaks without knowledge, And*ln his words are without wisdom.
Job*ln ought to be tried to the limit, Because*ln he answers like wicked men.
For*ln he adds rebellion to his sin; He*ln claps his hands among us, And*ln multiplies his words against God.’ ”
